botanical_details.genus: Pelargonium can be perennials, sub-shrubs or shrubs, sometimes succulent and mostly evergreen, with palmately lobed or pinnately divided leaves and clusters of slightly irregular, 5-petalled flowers
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Scented-leaved pelargoniums are evergreen shrubs or perennials with strongly aromatic foliage and small, single flowers in shades of pink, purple or white

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in neutral or alkaline, well-drained, moderately fertile soil in full sun. Lift outdoor plants, or take cuttings, and keep in frost-free, well-lit conditions over winter. See also pelargonium cultivation
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by softwood cuttings of non-flowering shoots in spring or summer
how_to_grow.pruning: Remove spent flowers and trim as required. Cut back hard if overwintering old plants indoors
how_to_grow.pests: Can get glasshouse whitefly, caterpillars, glasshouse leafhopper, aphids, vine weevil and root mealybugs
how_to_grow.diseases: Generally trouble free, but may be susceptible to grey moulds, pelargonium rust and Pelargonium virus
